pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:5.1: 50. The training rule on teaching pointless knowledge
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:6.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six were teaching pointless knowledge.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:6.4: “How can nuns teach pointless knowledge? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:7.4: “How can the nuns from the group of six teach pointless knowledge?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:7.5: “Is it true, monks, those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:7.8: How can the nuns from the group of six teach pointless knowledge?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:8.1: ‘If a nun teaches pointless knowledge, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:11.3: If she teaches by the syllable, then for every syllable she commits an offense entailing confession.
